   19: %%
   20: -module(logger_legacy_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -compile(export_all).
   23: -compile({nowarn_deprecated_function,[{gen_fsm,start,3},
   24:                                       {gen_fsm,send_all_state_event,2}]}).
   25: 
   26: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   27: -include_lib("kernel/include/logger.hrl").
   28: -include_lib("kernel/src/logger_internal.hrl").
   29: 
   30: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
   31: %%% This test suite test that log events from within OTP can be
   32: %%% delivered to legacy error_logger event handlers on the same format
   33: %%% as before 'logger' was introduced.
   34: %%%
   35: %%% Before changing the expected format of any of the log events in
   36: %%% this suite, please make sure that the backwards incompatibility it
   37: %%% introduces is ok.
   38: %%% -----------------------------------------------------------------
   39: 
   40: -define(check(Expected),
   41:         receive Expected ->
   42:                 [] = test_server:messages_get()
   43:         after 1000 ->
   44:                 ct:fail({report_not_received,
   45:                          {line,?LINE},
   46:                          {got,test_server:messages_get()}})
   47:         end).
   48: -define(check_no_flush(Expected),
   49:         receive Expected ->
   50:                 ok
   51:         after 1000 ->
   52:                 ct:fail({report_not_received,
   53:                          {line,?LINE},
   54:                          {got,test_server:messages_get()}})
   55:         end).
   56: 
   57: suite() ->
   58:     [{timetrap,{seconds,30}}].
   59: 
   60: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   61:     logger:add_handler(error_logger,error_logger,
   62:                        #{level=>info,filter_default=>stop}),
   63:     Config.
   64: 
   65: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   66:     logger:remove_handler(error_logger),
   67:     ok.
   68: 
   69: init_per_group(std, Config) ->
   70:     ok = logger:set_handler_config(
   71:            error_logger,filters,
   72:            [{domain,{fun logger_filters:domain/2,{log,super,[otp]}}}]),
   73:     Config;
   74: init_per_group(sasl, Config) ->
   75:     %% Since default level is notice, and progress reports are info,
   76:     %% we need to raise the global logger level to info in order to
   77:     %% receive these.
   78:     ok = logger:set_primary_config(level,info),
   79:     ok = logger:set_handler_config(
   80:            error_logger,filters,
   81:            [{domain,{fun logger_filters:domain/2,{log,super,[otp,sasl]}}}]),
   82: 
   83:     %% cth_log_redirect checks if sasl is started before displaying
   84:     %% any sasl reports - so just to see the real sasl reports in tc
   85:     %% log:
   86:     {ok,Apps} = application:ensure_all_started(sasl),
   87:     [{stop_apps,Apps}|Config];
   88: init_per_group(_Group, Config) ->
   89:     Config.
   90: 
   91: end_per_group(sasl, Config) ->
   92:     Apps = ?config(stop_apps,Config),
   93:     [application:stop(App) || App <- Apps],
   94:     ok = logger:set_primary_config(level,notice),
   95:     ok;
   96: end_per_group(_Group, _Config) ->
   97:     ok.
   98: 
   99: init_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
  100:     error_logger:add_report_handler(?MODULE,{event_handler,self()}),
  101:     Config.
  102: 
  103: end_per_testcase(Case, Config) ->
  104:     %% Using gen_event directly here, instead of
  105:     %% error_logger:delete_report_handler. This is to avoid
  106:     %% automatically stopping the error_logger process due to removing
  107:     %% the last handler.
  108:     gen_event:delete_handler(error_logger,?MODULE,[]),
  109:     try apply(?MODULE,Case,[cleanup,Config])
  110:     catch error:undef -> ok
  111:     end,
  112:     ok.
  113: 
  114: groups() ->
  115:     [{std,[],[gen_server,
  116:               gen_event,
  117:               gen_fsm,
  118:               gen_statem]},
  119:      {sasl,[],[sasl_reports,
  120:                supervisor_handle_info]}].
  121: 
  122: all() ->
  123:     [{group,std},
  124:      {group,sasl}].
  125: 
  126: gen_server(_Config) ->
  127:     {ok,Pid} = gen_server:start(?MODULE,gen_server,[]),
  128:     Msg = fun() -> erlang:error({badmatch,b}) end,
  129:     Pid ! Msg,
  130:     ?check({warning_msg,"** Undefined handle_info in ~p"++_,[?MODULE,Msg]}),
  131:     ok = gen_server:cast(Pid,Msg),
  132:     ?check({error,"** Generic server ~tp terminating"++_,
  133:             [Pid,{'$gen_cast',Msg},gen_server,{{badmatch,b},_}]}).
  134: 
  135: gen_event(_Config) ->
  136:     {ok,Pid} = gen_event:start(),
  137:     ok = gen_event:add_handler(Pid,?MODULE,gen_event),
  138:     Msg = fun() -> erlang:error({badmatch,b}) end,
  139:     Pid ! Msg,
  140:     ?check({warning_msg,"** Undefined handle_info in ~p"++_,[?MODULE,Msg]}),
  141:     gen_event:notify(Pid,Msg),
  142:     ?check({error,"** gen_event handler ~tp crashed."++_,
  143:             [?MODULE,Pid,Msg,gen_event,{{badmatch,b},_}]}).
  144: 
  145: gen_fsm(_Config) ->
  146:     {ok,Pid} = gen_fsm:start(?MODULE,gen_fsm,[]),
  147:     Msg = fun() -> erlang:error({badmatch,b}) end,
  148:     Pid ! Msg,
  149:     ?check({warning_msg,"** Undefined handle_info in ~p"++_,[?MODULE,Msg]}),
  150:     gen_fsm:send_all_state_event(Pid,Msg),
  151:     ?check({error,"** State machine ~tp terminating"++_,
  152:             [Pid,Msg,mystate,gen_fsm,{{badmatch,b},_}]}).
  153: 
  154: gen_statem(_Config) ->
  155:     {ok,Pid} = gen_statem:start(?MODULE,gen_statem,[]),
  156:     Msg = fun() -> erlang:error({badmatch,b}) end,
  157:     Pid ! Msg,
  158:     ?check({error,"** State machine ~tp terminating"++_,
  159:             [Pid,{info,Msg},{mystate,gen_statem},error,{badmatch,b}|_]}).
  160: 
  161: sasl_reports(Config) ->
  162:     App = {application,?MODULE,[{description, ""},
  163:                                 {vsn, "1.0"},
  164:                                 {modules, [?MODULE]},
  165:                                 {registered, []},
  166:                                 {applications, []},
  167:                                 {mod, {?MODULE, []}}]},
  168:     AppStr = io_lib:format("~p.",[App]),
  169:     Dir = ?config(priv_dir,Config),
  170:     AppFile = filename:join(Dir,?MODULE_STRING++".app"),
  171:     ok = file:write_file(AppFile,AppStr),
  172:     true = code:add_patha(Dir),
  173:     ok = application:start(?MODULE),
  174:     SupName = sup_name(),
  175:     Pid = whereis(SupName),
  176:     [{ch,ChPid,_,_}] = supervisor:which_children(Pid),
  177:     Node = node(),
  178:     ?check_no_flush({info_report,progress,[{application,?MODULE},
  179:                                            {started_at,Node}]}),
  180:     ?check({info_report,progress,[{supervisor,{local,SupName}},
  181:                                   {started,[{pid,ChPid}|_]}]}),
  182:     ok = gen_server:cast(ChPid, fun() ->
  183:                                         spawn_link(fun() -> receive x->ok end end)
  184:                                 end),
  185:     Msg = fun() -> erlang:error({badmatch,b}) end,
  186:     ok = gen_server:cast(ChPid,Msg),
  187:     ?check_no_flush({error,"** Generic server ~tp terminating"++_,
  188:                      [ChPid,{'$gen_cast',Msg},gen_server,{{badmatch,b},_}]}),
  189:     ?check_no_flush({error_report,crash_report,
  190:                      [[{initial_call,_},
  191:                        {pid,ChPid},
  192:                        {registered_name,[]},
  193:                        {process_label, undefined},
  194:                        {error_info,{error,{badmatch,b},_}},
  195:                        {ancestors,_},
  196:                        {message_queue_len,_},
  197:                        {messages,_},
  198:                        {links,[Pid,Neighbour]},
  199:                        {dictionary,_},
  200:                        {trap_exit,_},
  201:                        {status,_},
  202:                        {heap_size,_},
  203:                        {stack_size,_},
  204:                        {reductions,_}],
  205:                       [{neighbour,[{pid,Neighbour},
  206:                                    {registered_name,_},
  207:                                    {process_label, undefined},
  208:                                    {initial_call,_},
  209:                                    {current_function,_},
  210:                                    {ancestors,_},
  211:                                    {message_queue_len,_},
  212:                                    {links,[ChPid]},
  213:                                    {trap_exit,_},
  214:                                    {status,_},
  215:                                    {heap_size,_},
  216:                                    {stack_size,_},
  217:                                    {reductions,_},
  218:                                    {current_stacktrace,_}]}]]}),
  219:     ?check_no_flush({error_report,supervisor_report,
  220:                      [{supervisor,{local,SupName}},
  221:                       {errorContext,child_terminated},
  222:                       {reason,{{badmatch,b},_}},
  223:                       {offender,[{pid,ChPid}|_]}]}),
  224:     ?check({info_report,progress,[{supervisor,{local,SupName}},
  225:                                   {started,_}]}),
  226: 
  227:     ok = application:stop(?MODULE),
  228:     ?check({info_report,std_info,[{application,?MODULE},
  229:                                   {exited,stopped},
  230:                                   {type,temporary}]}).
  231: 
  232: sasl_reports(cleanup,_Config) ->
  233:     application:stop(?MODULE).
  234: 
  235: supervisor_handle_info(_Config) ->
  236:     {ok,Pid} = supervisor:start_link({local,sup_name()},?MODULE,supervisor),
  237:     ?check({info_report,progress,[{supervisor,_},{started,_}]}),
  238:     Pid ! msg,
  239:     ?check({error,"Supervisor received unexpected message: ~tp~n",[msg]}).
  240: 
  241: supervisor_handle_info(cleanup,_Config) ->
  242:     Pid = whereis(sup_name()),
  243:     unlink(Pid),
  244:     exit(Pid,shutdown).
  245: 
  246: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
  247: %%% Callbacks for error_logger event handler, gen_server, gen_statem,
  248: %%% gen_fsm, gen_event, supervisor and application.
  249: start(_,_) ->
  250:     supervisor:start_link({local,sup_name()},?MODULE,supervisor).
  251: 
  252: init(supervisor) ->
  253:     {ok,{#{},[#{id=>ch,start=>{gen_server,start_link,[?MODULE,gen_server,[]]}}]}};
  254: init(StateMachine) when StateMachine==gen_statem; StateMachine==gen_fsm ->
  255:     {ok,mystate,StateMachine};
  256: init(State) ->
  257:     {ok,State}.
  258: 
  259: %% error_logger event handler
  260: handle_event({Tag,_Gl,{_Pid,Type,Report}},{_,Pid}=State) ->
  261:     Pid ! {Tag,Type,Report},
  262:     {ok,State};
  263: %% other gen_event
  264: handle_event(Fun,State) when is_function(Fun) ->
  265:     Fun(),
  266:     {next_state,State}.
  267: 
  268: %% gen_fsm
  269: handle_event(Fun,State,Data) when is_function(Fun)  ->
  270:     Fun(),
  271:     {next_state,State,Data}.
  272: 
  273: %% gen_statem
  274: handle_event(info,Fun,State,Data) when is_function(Fun)  ->
  275:     Fun(),
  276:     {next_state,State,Data}.
  277: 
  278: %% gen_server
  279: handle_cast(Fun,State) when is_function(Fun)  ->
  280:     Fun(),
  281:     {noreply,State}.
  282: 
  283: %% gen_statem
  284: callback_mode() ->
  285:     handle_event_function.
  286: 
  287: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
  288: %%% Internal
  289: sup_name() ->
  290:     list_to_atom(?MODULE_STRING++"_sup").
